page.title: 18Preston-the derelict docks
page.content: Squares 5029 and 5129 are occupied by what was formerly Preston Docks but what is now a derelict landscape awaiting redevelopment since the closure of the docks in 1982. Most of the warehouses and other dock buildings have been demolished but some activity remains . The oil storage tanks and distribution complex run by 'Petrofina' are still there served by the railway link whose course has been re-routed across the area. The tar works are still there too. There are two new buildings. One is the Lancashire Analyst's Laboratory and the other is a signal box to control the trains going to the oil storage tanks as they pass over the dock gates. Both buildings are pyramidal in shape.
